duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform and manage geotechnical engineering investigations and studies
Work closely with clients, including owners, architects, and other design professionals to determine project needs
Prepare scopes of service, proposals, and budget estimates
Work closely with project management and field staff to provide technical recommendations
Train, mentor, and guide graduate professionals
Prepare and review geotechnical engineering reports
Other duties include geotechnical plan review, business development, and attending project design and construction meetings when needed

education_certification.credential: B.S. in Civil Engineering required, Master’s degree preferred
California PE registration is required, GE registration is required or can be obtained within 12 months
